Entities.Name: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
Entities.Definition: Refers to a thrombus (blood clot) that typically forms in a deep vein of the leg but can also occur in the veins of the upper limbs.

Sample Data.Sentence: A thrombus is observed in the brachial vein.

Entities.Name: Pulmonary Embolism (PE)
Entities.Definition: Occurs when one or more arteries in the lungs become blocked by a blood clot. The clot usually forms in another part of the body and travels to the lungs, where it becomes lodged.

Sample Data.Sentence: Filling defect seen in the pulmonary arteries may be an artifact.

Dataset.Name: Narrative Radiology Reports
Dataset.Details: Includes 4000 radiology reports from various imaging studies performed between 2008 and 2012 at the McGill University Health Network, which were manually coded for the presence of DVT and PE.

Annotation Guidelines.Description: Reports were manually reviewed by clinical experts, and cases of DVT and PE were identified based on the presence of specific imaging findings. Reports describing chronic thrombosis were coded as negative.
